alert.note: Alert for Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 1:20PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL RIO ARRIBA AND SOUTHEASTERN SAN JUAN COUNTIES THROUGH 145 PM MDT... At 120 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles southwest of El Huerfano Trading Post, or 29 miles south of Bloomfield, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Blanco Trading Post and El Huerfano Trading Post. This includes the following highways... Highway 550 between Mile Markers 119 and 148. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 56 and 57. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
